messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] seeking resources
messages.msgSnippet: Just had to add that I LOVE DK books!  They rarely make something that I dont want to add to my book arsenal! Holly ...
messages.messageBody:
Just had to add that I LOVE DK books! They rarely make something that I
dont want to add to my book arsenal!

Holly

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] seeking resources
messages.msgSnippet: We love all of the software from Dorling Kindersley.  They are a shop-at-home company, but they have a website and they can hook you up with the demonstrator
messages.messageBody:
We love all of the software from Dorling Kindersley. They are a
shop-at-home company, but they have a website and they can hook you up with
the demonstrator who is closest to you. Also, Zany Brainy, etc, seem to
sell a lot of their titles. We love their software.

Also, we have Math Blaster and Reading Blaster. These are also big hits in
my household.

Good luck,

Bonnie

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] seeking resources
messages.msgSnippet: ... Has anyone purchased Yoiks?  It s supposed to be by the same team that created Zoombinis.... which I still can t do all of.  Lisa
messages.messageBody:
> Two math favorites here have been Logical Journey of the Zoombinis and
> Disney's MathQuest. They are both full of opportunities for mathematical
> problem solving and a lot of fun too.
> Tracy


Has anyone purchased Yoiks? It's supposed to be by the same team that
created Zoombinis.... which I still can't do all of. <G>

Lisa

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] seeking resources
messages.msgSnippet: Annette, Two math favorites here have been Logical Journey of the Zoombinis and Disney s MathQuest.  They are both full of opportunities for mathematical
messages.messageBody:
Annette,
Two math favorites here have been Logical Journey of the Zoombinis and
Disney's MathQuest. They are both full of opportunities for mathematical
problem solving and a lot of fun too.
Tracy
